CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 28, 1951, pg. 2, reads: Detectives Guard Champ's Haircut - When the new heavy weight champion, Jersey Joe Walcott stopped off at "Woogie" Harris' Crystal Barber Shop on Wylie Avenue last Thursday to get a haircut after his knockout of Ezzard Charles, the previous night, the crowd that wanted to get a look at Walcott were so thick the police force had to protect him from his admirers. Here Detectives Eugene Parker, James Voyle Parker and John B. Thompson, who acted as bodyguards for Walcott while he was here, wait for the new champ to get his hair clipped by barber 'Speedy' Williams. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Copy of a photograph of "Jersey" Joe Walcott getting a haircut at Crystal Barber Shop with Pittsburgh police detectives
CatSubject_tab: Barber shops--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Barbers--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Boys--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Crystal Barber Shop (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Walcott, Jersey Joe, 1914-1994.
